page.title: 06Quarry Side Farm, Skidby.
page.content: Mr and Mrs Haskins own the farm, which is 530 acres. The farmhouse is on Main Street and the farmyard and fields are behind this. They have 100 sheep, 130 bullocks and four dogs. They have four tractors, a baler, a Landrover, an elevator and other farm machinery. There is a Dutch barn and a bullock shed which Mr Haskins and his son built. There are fields of barley, oil seed rape, wheat and grass behind the bullock shed, and also a disused chalk quarry. The sheep are kept for their wool and have lambs every March. The bullocks are bought when they are eight weeks old and fattened for beef. The wheat is grown to make flour, the barley is used to make beer and the oil seed rape is for cooking oil. Their son and another man work there.
